text: <@U680THK2S> which version of `AWS.jl` are you using (underlyingly)? Spaces in names was fixed in `v1.25.2`

elements.text: are you using (underlyingly)? Spaces in names was fixed in

text:
Hmm, what’s the exact problem you’re running across? I just stepped through the README in `AWSS3.jl` and it seems to work fine with spaces?

AWS@1.31.0,
AWSS3@0.8.3

```julia
using AWS, AWSS3
@service S3

S3.put_object("mattbr-test-bucket", "a a.txt")
p = S3Path("<s3://mattbr-test-bucket/>")

readdir(p)

file = joinpath(p, "a a.txt")
Status(
  device = 0,
  inode = 0,
  mode = -rw-rw-rw-,
  nlink = 0,
  uid = 501 (mattbr),
  gid = 20 (staff),
  rdev = 0,
  size = 0 (0.0),
  blksize = 4096 (4.0K),
  blocks = 0,
  mtime = 2021-04-05T16:12:19,
  ctime = 2021-04-05T16:12:19,
)

isfile(file)
true```

text: I have a path like `<s3://bucket/test> transfer/memes/cats.png` and I'm unable to do the AWS.jl/AWSS3 equivalent of `aws s3 ls <s3://bucket/test>\ transfer/memes/`

text:
```julia> p
p"<s3://mattbr-test-bucket/sub1/contains> space/"

julia> readdir(p)
1-element Vector{SubString{String}}:
 "a a.txt"```
Hmmm… seems to be fine for me? Unless I’m missing something here.
